content:
StreamManager StreamManager Class

In this Article

Edit

The Stream Manager class is the primary entry point to Reliable messaging. The stream manager(singleton) is registered as a State Provider in State Manager and manages states(streams, sessions) using the the power of WinFab to provide the reliability and consistency guarantees for reliable messaging.

Syntax

Declaration

public class StreamManager : IMessageStreamManager, IStateProvider2, IReliableStatePublic Class StreamManager
    Implements IMessageStreamManager, IStateProvider2, IReliableState

Completes checkpoint.

Creates an enumerable of currently active inbound streams
CreateOutboundStreamsEnumerableAsync()
CreateOutboundStreamsEnumerableAsync()

Creates an enumerable of currently active outbound streams
CreateStreamAsync(Transaction, PartitionKey, Uri, Int32)
CreateStreamAsync(Transaction, PartitionKey, Uri, Int32)

Create a durable message stream: target partition encapsulated as PartitionKey object A durable message stream consists of storage of the following state info

  1. StreamName
  2. StreamMetaData (Quota)
  3. StreamMetaData (Send Seq. Number)
  4. StreamMetaData (Delete (Receive) Seq. Number).

and creation of an instance of the inmemory message stream.
CreateStreamAsync(Transaction, Uri, Int64, Uri, Int32)
CreateStreamAsync(Transaction, Uri, Int64, Uri, Int32)

Create the stream: numbered target partition
CreateStreamAsync(Transaction, Uri, String, Uri, Int32)
CreateStreamAsync(Transaction, Uri, String, Uri, Int32)

Create the stream: named target partition
CreateStreamAsync(Transaction, Uri, Uri, Int32)
CreateStreamAsync(Transaction, Uri, Uri, Int32)

Create the stream: singleton target partition; will be collapsed to a single method instead of three, using IPartitionKey
GetInboundStreamAsync(Transaction, Guid)
GetInboundStreamAsync(Transaction, Guid)

Get a specific inbound stream given its StreamId, This also verifies if the stream actually exists in the statefull consolidated store by ensuring the stream is fetched under a store transaction with isolation level of read repeatable.
GetInboundStreamAsync(Guid)
GetInboundStreamAsync(Guid)

Get a specific inbound stream given its StreamId
GetInboundStreamAsync(Uri, PartitionKey)
GetInboundStreamAsync(Uri, PartitionKey)

Get a specific inbound stream given its Stream Name and Partition Key
GetOutboundStreamAsync(Transaction, Uri, PartitionKey)
GetOutboundStreamAsync(Transaction, Uri, PartitionKey)

Get a specific outbound stream given its Stream Name and Partition Key, This also verifies if the stream actually exists in the statefull consolidated store by ensuring the stream is fetched under a store transaction with isolation level of repeatable read. The reason to confirm for stream existence in the statefull store is due to a quirk in the create outbound stream () process, where in the stream is created in memory during the create stream process and it does not get removed if the application transaction during create stream is aborted.

GetOutboundStreamAsync(Guid)
GetOutboundStreamAsync(Guid)

Get a specific outbound stream given its StreamId
GetOutboundStreamAsync(Uri, PartitionKey)
GetOutboundStreamAsync(Uri, PartitionKey)

Get a specific outbound stream given its Stream Name and Partition Key
PerformCheckpointAsync(CancellationToken)
PerformCheckpointAsync(CancellationToken)

Checkpoints state to local disk.
PrepareCheckpointAsync(Int64, CancellationToken)
PrepareCheckpointAsync(Int64, CancellationToken)

Prepares for checkpoint by snapping the state to be checkpointed.
PrepareForRemoveAsync(Transaction, TimeSpan, CancellationToken)
PrepareForRemoveAsync(Transaction, TimeSpan, CancellationToken)

Prepares for removing state provider.
RegisterCallbackByPrefixAsync(Uri, IInboundStreamCallback)
RegisterCallbackByPrefixAsync(Uri, IInboundStreamCallback)

Register the call back for a stream name prefix. Inbound stream callbacks are routed to this callback when streams matches the prefix. In case of conflicts, the longest prefix match is selected first.
